duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform preventive and corrective maintenance on mechanical and electrical equipment, including inspection and lubrication.
Troubleshoot and repair failures in hydraulic and pneumatic systems.
Disconnect, replace, and reconnect 120V and 480V motors within the plant using proper procedures.
Knowledge of motor starters, soft starts, DC drives, and variable frequency drives.
Repair and maintain all plant equipment.
Create notifications and enter work history and comments into SAP.
Inspect equipment for compliance of safety and quality systems.
Maintain tools in safe and good working condition.
Perform General Plant labor in all operational areas of the plant.
Possess basic trouble shooting skills related to low/med/hi voltage equipment.
Read and understand technical diagrams and perform mathematical calculations as required.
Effectively communicate and interact with supervisors, managers, and peers.
Operate a computer and possess a valid Texas driver’s license.
Be responsible for the facilities’ Safe Food initiative based on quality systems and company policies.
Work long hours during plant outages and be on call on weekends.
Tolerate working outside in severe weather conditions and exposure to industrial environment.
Lift over 50 pounds and work extended shifts to complete repairs.
Be flexible to schedule changes, including overtime.

education_certification.credential: 0-3 years of previous electrical/instrumentation experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
